title: 2 arrested in deadly shooting of 16-year-old Midwest City boy
content:
MIDWEST CITY —
Two Oklahoma City men were arrested in the deadly shooting of a 16-year-old boy in Midwest City.
Keandre Jamel Bowser was shot around 1:40 p.m. Friday after an argument in the 100 block of West Michael Drive. Witnesses told police that two men involved in the shooting fled in a red Pontiac Grand Am.
Detectives found the car's owner, who said Morttellus Dashown Hill and Christopher Michael Johnson Jr., both 19, were responsible for the shooting, according to officials.
Hill and Johnson were arrested near their homes in the 1800 block of Northeast 53rd Street on Friday night and Saturday morning, respectively.
Hill has been charged with first-degree murder. No bail has been set for his release.
Johnson was charged with accessory to commit a felony after the fact, and his bail was set at $10,000.
“This homicide is not a reflection of our city, but an indictment on our society,” Midwest City Police Chief Brandon Clabes said. “Now, instead of resolving disputes in a civil manner, these young adults resort to violence, which is a direct correlation on how they are raised without character qualities or respect for life.
"We continue to talk about justice reform but it all starts with the family unit, if we don’t demand parents take responsibility in raising their children correctly we will never win the war on violent crime and senseless deaths. It is very frustrating for law enforcement."
